visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing the relationship between income inequality (Gini Coefficient) and intentional homicide rates using a time-series-inspired progression with synthetic data extrapolation

title.text: Income Inequality and Homicide Rates Correlation (1965-1994)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two continuous numerical variables: Gini Coefficient (independent variable, range 20-65) and Homicide Rate (dependent variable, range 16-37). Synthetic data maintains domain validity through linear progression (R²=0.98) with controlled noise (σ=1.2), simulating real-world economic studies. The line chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while maintaining Cairo's principle of proportional ink through color-contrasted series. A μ=27.9 baseline with σ=7.1 variation reflects typical homicide rate distributions in industrialized nations during the study period. The stepped interval design (5-point Gini increments) enables clear visualization of inequality thresholds while maintaining numerical axis precision.
